page.title: 12Birds of the River Aeron
page.content: The River Aeron acts a magnet for interesting wildlife as it meanders through the village of Llangeitho.The{Heron}feeds on the young{trout}and the{Dipper}can often be seen swimming under the water of the Aeron.Ducks to be seen include surface feeders such as{Mallard}and most recently the{rare saw-billed {diving}duck,the Goosander. This beautiful duck first came to Wales in 1971 and bred near Llangeitho for the first time in 1984. The wagtails include the Pied and the dainty{Grey Wagtail. Moorhens and{Curlews}still nest near the Aeron. Occasioally you may see holes in the river banks where{Sand Martins}nest. These are now very rare because of the drought in Africa.The beautiful blue {Kingfisher}is only a very rare visitor to the river Aeron.
